dialogue.speaker: Colette
dialogue.text: No! Come back! But... Mom and Dad.. were a part of Notre Monde? And they left to give me a clean slate..?

dialogue.speaker: Colette
dialogue.text: I’ve been killing the mafia this whole time... just for my own family to be ex-mafia?

dialogue.speaker: Colette
dialogue.text: Then why... Why have I been doing this? I’ve just thrown away what they’ve given me.

dialogue.speaker: Colette
dialogue.text: I’ve thrown away my chance at a free life. This isn’t right. I have to fix this. I have to-

dialogue.speaker: Colette
dialogue.text: You’re... wait. This place. What’s the date?

dialogue.speaker: Teenage Colette
dialogue.text: Hello? I asked you a question-

dialogue.speaker: Colette
dialogue.text: And I asked YOU a question, Colette. What is the date?

dialogue.speaker: Teenage Colette
dialogue.text: How did you... It’s January 19, 2014. Are you...?

dialogue.speaker: Colette
dialogue.text: Yes. And listen, Colette. You can’t kill that mafia member today.

dialogue.speaker: Teenage Colette
dialogue.text: But I’ve been tracking him down for months. You of all people should understand.

dialogue.speaker: Colette
dialogue.text: Colette. Your parents are ex-mafia. They left that life for you. You’re just going to undo all of their work.

dialogue.speaker: Colette
dialogue.text: What you’re doing right now is an insult to their life.

dialogue.speaker: Teenage Colette
dialogue.text: But... we need to get revenge for them. We need them to pay.

dialogue.speaker: Colette
dialogue.text: This goes against all of what they worked for. Don’t you understand that? You have to stop the cycle.

dialogue.speaker: Teenage Colette
dialogue.text: Selfish? But I have to do this. I guess you really don’t understand.

dialogue.speaker: Colette
dialogue.text: And I guess you will never understand either, as you are now. I should have known, really. I have to make you understand.
